intro: Omphalodes aliena, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its small, hairy, and usually blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a low-growing habit with succulent, glandular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Native to Europe and parts of western Asia, it thrives in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Boraginaceae family, with adaptations suited to its arid and temperate habitats.
